Return only the one-paragraph video description without Markdown formatting or introductory text.

Finally, describe the **camera’s height relative to the subject**, if relevant. Indicate whether the camera is positioned at the subject's height, above them, or below them. We already have this information provided at the end. If it’s not provided, try to describe it by yourself.

If **shot size or spatial position** changes, describe how these transitions occur clearly, specifying both the **initial and final states**.

In addition, the human-written captions below already describe the subjects (if any) and the scenery in this video but do not capture their spatial composition and movements. He is wearing a plain white t-shirt and is partially covered by a white comforter. Lying on his side, he has both hands placed forward beside the pillow, with his eyes wide open, looking forward with a focused and somewhat troubled expression, as if unable to sleep.**
Human-Written Description for Scenery: **The scene takes place inside a small, sterile, and enclosed sleeping compartment with plain white walls. A narrow bed, made up with a white pillow and a white comforter, fills the confined space. The entire scene is rendered in a desaturated, cool-toned color palette, creating a nearly monochromatic and clinical atmosphere. The view is partially obstructed on the right side by a light-colored vertical panel. A person with very light blond hair, dressed in a white t-shirt, is seen lying awake in the bed before shifting their position slightly.**

Please note that the video features **salient human subjects**, so you should focus on describing the spatial framing and movements of them.
